author: Reuters Editorial
title: House sets Tuesday vote on bill to avoid government shutdown
text:
February 2, 2018 / 10:22 PM / in 17 hours House sets Tuesday vote on bill to avoid government shutdown Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The U.S. House of Representatives plans to vote on Tuesday on legislation to keep federal agencies operating beyond Feb. 8, when existing funds expire, a senior House Republican aide said on Friday. 
The aide did not provide details, however, on the duration of this latest-in-a-series of temporary funding measures. Congressional negotiators are fighting over defense and non-defense spending levels for the fiscal year that ends on Sept. 30, as well as other unrelated matters. Reporting By Richard Cowan; Editing by Daniel Wallis
